thread.title: Libraries engage in war of words on Twitter
thread.title_full: Libraries engage in war of words on Twitter

title: Libraries engage in war of words on Twitter
text:
Posted: 3:26 p.m. Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015 Libraries engage in war of words on Twitter Kansas City Royals celebrates their 4-3 win against the Toronto Blue Jays in Game 6 of baseball's American League Championship Series on Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, in Kansas City, Mo. (AP Photo/Jae C. Hong) Related > More By Cox Media Group National Content Desk 
Now that the Kansas City Royals are heading to the World Series, a war of words has come to light between libraries in Kansas City and Toronto as the American League Championship Series was decided. 
It all started on Oct. 20, when the Kansas City library posted #bookspinepoetry message to the Toronto library on Twitter. 
The two battled back and forth until the Royals won Game 6 Friday. THAT'S A WIN! Hello, World Series!! Good game @torontolibrary ! It's been amazing. #TakeTheCrown pic.twitter.com/kS1DI749JW — KCMO Public Library (@KCLibrary) October 24, 2015 
The Royals will take on the New York Mets, and it appears the book battle will continue, with the New York Public Library supporting its hometown team. Congrats, @KCLibrary and @Royals ! See you at the World Series. pic.twitter.com/hS0gPSlNmz
